body:
Problem:
Search for node_modules uses a costly call to fn.globpath; the final path resolution was not working on Linux.

Solution:
A custom function to resolve ngserver location from CMD wrappers on Windows; and the corrected final path.

comment_data.body:
`readblob()` is a less verbose way to get file contents

```suggestion
  local ok, content = pcall(vim.fn.readblob, cmd_path)
  if not ok or not content then
    return cmd_path
  end

  local target = content:match('%s%"%%dp0%%\\([^\r\n]-ngserver[^\r\n]-)%"')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,6 +16,40 @@
 -- in order to use your projects configured versions.
 local fs, fn, uv = vim.fs, vim.fn, vim.uv
 
+-- Recursively solve for the ngserver original path on Windows
+local function resolve_cmd_shim(cmd_path)
+  if not cmd_path:lower():match('%ngserver.cmd$') then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local ok, f = pcall(io.open, cmd_path, 'r')
+  if not ok or not f then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local content = f:read('*a')
+  f:close()
+
+  if not content then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local target = content:match('%s%"%%dp0%%\\([^\r\n]-ngserver[^\r\n]-)%"')

comment_data.body:
a brief input/output example makes a world of difference to help show what something does
```suggestion
-- Recursively solve for the ngserver original path on Windows
--
-- "??" => "??"
```

@@ -16,6 +16,40 @@

+-- Recursively solve for the ngserver original path on Windows

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
-- resolve_cmd_shim('/home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver')
-- => 'home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
--
-- -- Recursive case: cmd_path points to a CMD wrapper (Windows)
-- resolve_cmd_shim('C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/.bin/ngserver.cmd')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -16,6 +16,44 @@
 -- in order to use your projects configured versions.
 local fs, fn, uv = vim.fs, vim.fn, vim.uv
 
+--- Recursively solve for the original ngserver path on Windows
+-- For a given ngserver path:
+--   - If it is not a CMD wrapper, return the path;
+--   - Or else, extract the path from the CMD wrapper.
+--
+-- @param cmd_path (string) path for the ngserver executable or its CMD wrapper.
+-- @return (string) the original executable path for ngserver
+-- @usage
+-- -- Base case: cmd_path already points to ngserver (expected behavior on Linux)
+-- resolve_cmd_shin('/home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver')
+-- => 'home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+--
+-- -- Recursive case: cmd_path points to a CMD wrapper (Windows)
+-- resolve_cmd_shin('C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/.bin/ngserver.cmd')

@@ -16,6 +16,44 @@
 -- in order to use your projects configured versions.
 local fs, fn, uv = vim.fs, vim.fn, vim.uv
 
+--- Recursively solve for the original ngserver path on Windows
+-- For a given ngserver path:
+--   - If it is not a CMD wrapper, return the path;
+--   - Or else, extract the path from the CMD wrapper.
+--
+-- @param cmd_path (string) path for the ngserver executable or its CMD wrapper.
+-- @return (string) the original executable path for ngserver
+-- @usage
+-- -- Base case: cmd_path already points to ngserver (expected behavior on Linux)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('/home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver')
+-- => 'home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+--
+-- -- Recursive case: cmd_path points to a CMD wrapper (Windows)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/.bin/ngserver.cmd')
+-- => 'C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+local function resolve_cmd_shim(cmd_path)
+  vim.notify(cmd_path)

@@ -16,6 +16,44 @@
 -- in order to use your projects configured versions.
 local fs, fn, uv = vim.fs, vim.fn, vim.uv
 
+--- Recursively solve for the original ngserver path on Windows
+-- For a given ngserver path:
+--   - If it is not a CMD wrapper, return the path;
+--   - Or else, extract the path from the CMD wrapper.
+--
+-- @param cmd_path (string) path for the ngserver executable or its CMD wrapper.
+-- @return (string) the original executable path for ngserver
+-- @usage
+-- -- Base case: cmd_path already points to ngserver (expected behavior on Linux)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('/home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver')
+-- => 'home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+--
+-- -- Recursive case: cmd_path points to a CMD wrapper (Windows)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/.bin/ngserver.cmd')
+-- => 'C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+local function resolve_cmd_shim(cmd_path)
+  vim.notify(cmd_path)
+  if not cmd_path:lower():match('%ngserver.cmd$') then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local ok, content = pcall(fn.readblob, cmd_path)
+  if not ok or not content then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local target = content:match('%s%"%%dp0%%\\([^\r\n]-ngserver[^\r\n]-)%"')
+  if not target then
+    return cmd_path
+  end
+
+  local dir_name = fs.dirname(cmd_path)
+
+  local full = fs.normalize(fs.joinpath(dir_name, target))

@@ -16,6 +16,44 @@
 -- in order to use your projects configured versions.
 local fs, fn, uv = vim.fs, vim.fn, vim.uv
 
+--- Recursively solve for the original ngserver path on Windows
+-- For a given ngserver path:
+--   - If it is not a CMD wrapper, return the path;
+--   - Or else, extract the path from the CMD wrapper.
+--
+-- @param cmd_path (string) path for the ngserver executable or its CMD wrapper.
+-- @return (string) the original executable path for ngserver
+-- @usage
+-- -- Base case: cmd_path already points to ngserver (expected behavior on Linux)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('/home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver')
+-- => 'home/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+--
+-- -- Recursive case: cmd_path points to a CMD wrapper (Windows)
+-- resolve_cmd_shim('C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/.bin/ngserver.cmd')
+-- => 'C:/Users/user/project/node_modules/@angular/language-server/bin/ngserver'
+local function resolve_cmd_shim(cmd_path)
+  vim.notify(cmd_path)

comment_regular_data.body: I tested this solution both on Windows (11) and Linux (Arch), with the server installed globally with `npm`  or on Neovim data folder with a package manager (Mason). I didn't compare loading times with the former solution, but since the new function is not called on Linux, it should improve performance.

I tested this up on my Linux / WSL, with the following setups, and it works like a charm.
- Installed locally with `npm`
- Installed globally with `npm`
- Installed with Mason

Each of them have been tested on:
- a project using an older version of Angular (v18)
- a project using the latest version of Angular (v20)
- a monorepo (Nx) project (using Angular v19)
- a non-angular project

For each of them, the appropriate version of Angular (based on `package.json`) was correctly used, and the last one did not result in an error as mentioned #4175

Thanks for the fix!

title: fix(angularls): improves node_modules path resolution
